item.title: Install Hugo in Windows
item.description: Hugo comes in three versions: Standard, Extended, and Extended/Deploy. The Standard edition covers core functionalities, while Extended adds advanced options, with Extended/Deploy** offering further deployment features. Setting Up Your Directories Open File Explorer and create a folder, e.g., C:\Hugo, and inside it, a bin folder. Installing Hugo Download the latest Hugo executable from Hugo releases. Create a New Hugo Site hugo new site <name of site> cd <name of site> git init git submodule add https://github.com/binokochumolvarghese/lightbi-hugo themes/lightbi-hugo echo "theme = 'lightbi-hugo'" >> config.toml hugo server After the above copy the contents of exampleSite to the content folder in your website.

item.title: Features of Lightbi
item.description: General Three Main Content Sections: Blog Notes Collections (Newsletter) Responsive Design: Built with a mobile-first approach for seamless viewing on any device. Card-Based Theme: Flexible image placement options: Image at the top of the card Image in the middle of the card Image at the bottom of the card No image option Menu Location Indicator: Clear visual cues for active menu items. Multilingual Support: Includes a language selector for easy switching between languages.

item.title: Parameters in Lightbi
item.description: Below is a list of configurable parameters in the Lightbi theme, along with descriptions to help you customize your site effectively. You can be adjust the below parameters in your hugo.toml file. Theme Parameters readingTime Type: Boolean (true or false) Description: When set to true, displays an estimated reading time for each post. This helps readers gauge how long it will take to read the content. wordCount Type: Boolean Description: Enables or disables the word count display for each post.
